programme.title: Men's Team Final | Artistic Gymnastics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Team Final took place at the Bercy Arena, Paris, on 29/07/24. Team Japan won Gold, People's Republic of China won Silver, and the United States of America finished the podium.

programme.title: Men's Individual All-Around Final | Artistic Gymnastics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's All-Around Artistic Gymnastics Final took place on 31/07/2024 at the Bercy Arena, Paris. Shinnosuke Oka (JPN) claimed the Gold, Boheng Zhang (CHN) took the Silver, and Ruoteng Xiao (CHN) the Bronze.

programme.title: Men's Team QFs/SFs/Finals | Archery | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Quarter-Finals, Semi-Finals and Finals for Men's Team Archery took place on 29/07/2024 at Invalides, Paris. The Republic of Korea won Gold, The People's Republic of China won Silver, and Mexico won Bronze.

programme.title: Archery vs race walk with Kanie Miki & Tanii Takayuki | Sports Swap Japan
programme.desc: What happens when a race walk champion tries to shoot an arrow?

programme.title: Gamers Vs: Episode 3
programme.desc: Popular Gamers apply their gaming skills to Olympic sports with the help of world-class athletes and international coaches. Watch them trying the sports of Curling, Archery and Table Tennis.

programme.title: An Se Young (KOR) v He Bing Jiao (CHN) - Women's Singles Gold Medal Match | Badminton | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
The Women's Singles Gold Medal match between An Se Young (KOR) v He Bing Jiao (CHN) which took place at the Porte de La Chapelle Arena on 05/08/24. An Se Young (KOR) won the match with a final score of 2:0.
The medal ceremony saw An Se Young (KOR) take Gold, He Bing Jiao (CHN) take Silver and Gregoria Tunjung (INA) take the Bronze medal.

programme.title: Jia Min Yeo (SGP) v Dorsa Yavarivafa (EOR) - Women's Singles Group Play | Badminton | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Singles Group Play match between Jia Min Yeo (SGP) v Dorsa Yavarivafa (EOR) took place on 27/07/2024 at La Chapelle Arena. Jia Min Yeo (SGP) won the match with a score of 2:0.

programme.title: Badminton vs Cricket with Srikanth Kidambi and Yuzvendra Chahal | Sports Swap India
programme.desc: Can cricketers play badminton? And what happens when India’s badminton champion Srikanth Kidambi swaps his racket for a cricket bat?

programme.title: Youth take Centre Stage | The Academy
programme.desc: We head behind the scenes and hang out with of some of India’s rising badminton talent.

programme.title: B-Girls Final | Breaking | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The B-Girls Final took place on La Concorde 1, Paris, on 09/08/2024. AMI (JPN) won the Gold, Nicka (LTU) claimed the Silver, and 671 (CHN) won the Bronze.

programme.title: Anatomy of: Skateboard, Badminton and Athletics
programme.desc: In a sports science lab, we studied the physiques of skateboarder Tom Schaar, badminton player Marcus Ellis, and hurdler and bobsledder Lolo Jones to find our what makes them special at their sports.

programme.title: From NYC to Alaska, meet the pioneers and US champion | Breaking Life
programme.desc: As the birthplace of a global hip-hop movement, we meet some of the pioneers of Breaking in New-York City. While Kid Glyde shares his passion for breaking with the next generation at his Harlem studio, three thousand miles away in Anchorage Alaska, B-Boy Icey Ives, two-time US national champion, melts the ice with his local crew Frozen Flow while being a community leader, a teacher and a role model for the youth living in extremely challenging conditions.

programme.title: French breakers set the scene for Paris 2024 Olympic Games| Breaking Life
programme.desc: France is a cultural melting pot. It’s also one of the biggest countries for Breaking with more than a thousand battles every year and some of the greatest international competitions. It’s also in Paris 2024 that Breaking will make its Olympic debut. Dany Dann came to France from French Guyana to pursue a life in dance. Now, he juggles early morning shifts as a nurse, daily training and being a father – always with an eye on the next battle. Now reigning national champion, he trains with French national team members B-Girl Carlota and B-Boy Marlone for the WDSF World Breaking Championship in Paris.

programme.title: Young breakers take over the streets of Medellin | Breaking Life
programme.desc: Colombia used to be one of the most dangerous countries in the world but has found new life through a revival in urban arts, becoming a global creative mecca. B-Girl Luma and 4Eskuela hip hop school, where she learnt Breaking and is now a teacher, have been instrumental to this change in Medellin (Colombia). But it’s not been an easy journey for Luma who also had her doubts about what she can really achieve through dancing. By winning international dance events around the world, she is now confident it gave her a career and a drive, also when teaching young kids in her neighbourhood. She is keen to participate to Paris 2024.

programme.title: SRB-GER - Men's Bronze Medal Game | Basketball | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Bronze Medal Game took place at Bercy Arena, France, on 10/08/2024. Serbia won the Bronze with a final score SRB 93:83 GER.

programme.title: Manuel: the next big thing in Angola’s favorite sport | Playing Fields
programme.desc: A young basketball player from Angola shows us what the sport means to him and dreams of the endelless posibilities the future holds.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Basketball Player: The Incredible Stamina of Laetitia Guapo
programme.desc: We took French 3x3 basketball player Laetitia Guapo and examined her unique physical characteristics in a sports science lab to find out the what it takes to be FIBA's world number 1 ranked female basketball player. With the help of Olympian Lolo Jones, each episode of our sports science original series Anatomy of studies the powers and physiques of an elite athlete to find out what makes them special in their sport.

programme.title: BEL-AUS - Women's Bronze Medal Game | Basketball | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Women's Bronze Medal Game took place at the Bercy Arena, France, on 11/08/2024. Australia won Bronze with a final score AUS 85:81 BEL.

programme.title: Can NBA and Dream Team star Laettner teach this team to win?
programme.desc: Team USA and NBA legend Christian Laettner shows the Garinger High School varsity basketball team how they can improve their game.

programme.title: The story of the basketball legend who never gave up on her Olympic dream
programme.desc: In “The Queen”, Brazilian legend Hortencia Marcari explains why she came out of retirement only months after giving birth.

programme.title: Norwegian duo are targeting back-to-back Olympic Gold | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Reigning World and Olympic Champions Christian Sørum and Anders Mol are dominating beach volleyball. Their partnership, rooted in a Viking mentality, has kept them atop the sport for six years. They are now preparing for a historic back-to-back Olympic gold at Paris 2024 to honour Christian's mother's legacy.

programme.title: Women's Discus Throw Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Discus Throw Final took place on 05/08/2024 at Stade de France. Valarie ALLMAN (USA) won the Gold medal, FENG Bin (CHN) won the Silver medal and Sandra ELKASEVIC (CRO) won the Bronze.

programme.title: The Distance | Five Rings Films
programme.desc: The story of an enduring Japanese marathon tradition and a humble champion named Naoko Takahashi who captured her nation’s imagination with a run for the ages at the 2000 Olympic Games.

programme.title: Ethiopia’s Derartu Tulu I Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of the first black African female gold medallist Derartu Tulu, who is now leading Ethiopia’s national athletics team.

programme.title: Men's Long Jump Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Long Jump Final took place at the Stade de France, France, on 06/08/2024. Miltiadis Tentoglou (GRE) won the Gold with a distance of 8.48m. Wayne Pinnock (JAM) won the Silver, Mattia Furlani (ITA) completed the podium.

programme.title: Semi-Finals & Finals - Day 15 | Canoe Sprint | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session contains the Women's Kayak Single 500m Semi-Finals and Finals, the Men's Kayak Single 1000m Semi-Finals and Finals and the Women's Canoe Single 200m Semi-Finals and Finals which took place at the Vaires-Sur-Marne Nautical Stadium on 10/08/24.
The Women's Kayak Single 500m was won by Lisa Carrington (NZL) with Gold, Tamara Csipes (HUN) with Silver and Emma Aastrand Jorgensen (DEN) with Bronze.
The Men's Kayak Single 1000m was won by Josef Dostal (CZE) with Gold, Adam Varga (HUN) with Silver and Balint Kopasz (HUN) with Bronze.
The Women's Canoe Single 200m was won by Katie Vincent (CAN) with Gold, Nevin Harrison (USA) with Silver and Yarisleidis Cirilo Duboys (CUB) with Bronze.

programme.title: Dakar breakers see new opportunities with Olympic debut| Breaking Life
programme.desc: With a classical and traditional African dance background, B-Boy Zaza is a key member of Power Crew, one of the most successful crew in Senegal. Joined by his young brother Emma, their crew is more like a family and made them travel to major global events. Now a teacher, tasked with navigating the challenges of his community, the dance gives him hope for a brighter future. With Paris 2024 and Dakar Youth Olympic Games in 2026, the elders and next generation alike to build their own future and for the sport as it takes roots in Senegal. Organized by the local dance federation, they participate in the Battle National, featuring some of Senegal’s best emerging talents.

programme.title: From NYC to Alaska, meet the pioneers and US champion | Breaking Life
programme.desc: As the birthplace of a global hip-hop movement, we meet some of the pioneers of Breaking in New-York City. While Kid Glyde shares his passion for breaking with the next generation at his Harlem studio, three thousand miles away in Anchorage Alaska, B-Boy Icey Ives, two-time US national champion, melts the ice with his local crew Frozen Flow while being a community leader, a teacher and a role model for the youth living in extremely challenging conditions.

programme.title: Anatomy of: Skateboard, Badminton and Athletics
programme.desc: In a sports science lab, we studied the physiques of skateboarder Tom Schaar, badminton player Marcus Ellis, and hurdler and bobsledder Lolo Jones to find our what makes them special at their sports.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Basketball Player: The Incredible Stamina of Laetitia Guapo
programme.desc: We took French 3x3 basketball player Laetitia Guapo and examined her unique physical characteristics in a sports science lab to find out the what it takes to be FIBA's world number 1 ranked female basketball player. With the help of Olympian Lolo Jones, each episode of our sports science original series Anatomy of studies the powers and physiques of an elite athlete to find out what makes them special in their sport.

programme.title: Men's Hammer Throw Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Hammer Throw Final took place at the Stade de France, France, on 04/08/24. Ethan Katzberg (CAN) won the Gold with a distance of 84.12m. Bence Halasz (HUN) claimed the Silver, and Mykhaylo Kokhan (UKR) completed the podium.

programme.title: Flag and Family 1
programme.desc: Profiles of what it means to be a first-generation athlete as they try to balance national and personal identities.

programme.title: Track and Field - Day 11 - Morning | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This event took place on 06/08/2024 at the Stade of France. It includes the Women's 200m and 800m Finals, the Men's Pole Vault Final, the Women's Hammer Throw Final, the Men's 400m Hurdles Victory Ceremony, the Women's Long Jump Victory Ceremony, the Men's 200m Semifinals as well as the Men's 110m Hurdles and 5000m Rounds 1 and the Men's Shot Put Qualifying Round.

programme.title: London legacy lives on with the help of Jessica Ennis-Hill and Etienne Stott
programme.desc: Four years on, we conquer canoe's Legacy Loop and meet a teenager emulating Jessica Ennis-Hill and an Olympic baby named after her.

programme.title: B-Boys Final | Breaking | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The B-Boys Final took place on La Concorde 1, Paris, on 10/08/2024. Phil Wizard (CAN) won the Gold, Danny Dann (FRA) claimed the Silver, and Victor (USA) won the Bronze.

programme.title: India’s growing breaking scene makes room for B-Girls | Breaking Life
programme.desc: India’s Breaking scene started in the early 2000’s and has since exploded in popularity. While mostly male dominated, women are increasingly accepted and celebrated in the Indian Breaking scene. We meet B-Girl Jo, the two-time BC One India champion from Bangalore, as she travels alone to Mumbai. There, she meets her friend Flying Machine who organizes a community celebration event where B-Girls have a chance to battle it out. As a leader for Indian female hip-hop dancers, Jo reflects on her position in the society. With her own hip-hop and yoga studio and inspired by the challenges she’s already had to overcome, she examines her journey with both excitement and wisdom.

programme.title: Dakar breakers see new opportunities with Olympic debut| Breaking Life
programme.desc: With a classical and traditional African dance background, B-Boy Zaza is a key member of Power Crew, one of the most successful crew in Senegal. Joined by his young brother Emma, their crew is more like a family and made them travel to major global events. Now a teacher, tasked with navigating the challenges of his community, the dance gives him hope for a brighter future. With Paris 2024 and Dakar Youth Olympic Games in 2026, the elders and next generation alike to build their own future and for the sport as it takes roots in Senegal. Organized by the local dance federation, they participate in the Battle National, featuring some of Senegal’s best emerging talents.

programme.title: USA-FRA - Men's Gold Medal Game | Basketball | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Gold Medal Game took place at Bercy Arena, France, on 10/08/2024. The United States of America won the Gold with a final score: USA 98:87 FRA.

programme.title: The Golden Generation | Five Rings Films
programme.desc: How a once-in-a-generation Argentina men's basketball team, led by Manu Ginobili, brought down the USA “Dream Team” and won the gold at the Athens 2004 Olympic Games.

programme.title: Women's Final | Cycling BMX Racing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
The Cycling BMX Racing Women's Finals took place on 02/08/2024 at Saint-Quentin-en-Yvelines BMX Stadium.
Saya Sakakibara (AUS) won Gold, Manon Veenstra (NED) won Silver and Zoe Classens (SUI) won Bronze.

programme.title: Women's Kayak (K1) Semi-Final & Final | Canoe Slalom | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Kayak (K1) Semifinal and Final took place at Nautical St - White Water, on 28/07/24. The Australian Jessica Fox won the Gold with a time of 96.08 seconds. Klaudia Zwolinska (POL) won the Silver, and Kimberley Woods (GBR) won the Bronze Medal.

programme.title: The enduring family legacy of Olympic canoe legend Matija Ljubek
programme.desc: The sprint canoeist Matija Ljubek won four medals at four Olympic Games for Yugoslavia and became a national hero in the process. He passed on his love for the sport to his son Nikica, who became an Olympian himself.

programme.title: El Palomar Basketball Team
programme.desc: Team USA Olympic hero Kara Wolters travels to Mexico to try to turn around the fortunes of a struggling basketball team.

programme.title: Mixed Team QFs/SFs/Finals | Archery | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Quarter-Finals, Semi-Finals and Finals for Mixed Team Archery took place on 02/08/2024 at Invalides. Korea won Gold, Germany won Silver, and United States won Bronze.
